content.description: Sit start with hands on the bottom two blue marks and feet on the green marks. Mantle up to grab the small crack circled blue. Your feet can only touch the two original footholds and the two starting handholds. Dyno to the top, directly in the middle, grabbing hold of a small flake that sits about 8 inches in from the edge. Do not grab the edge of the top rock! After grabbing, your feet can go anywhere to top out.
content.location: South face of the large boulder

content.description: Heel hook around the boulder then rock up on your heel to top out. Hands start on SW face of the boulder. Do NOT use any section of the boulder below the hand start.

Hands start on the West face, toe hook the ledge on the East face. Work your way underneath the arch to the East side of the boulder. Do NOT use any section of the boulder below the circled areas in the photos.
Start on the opposite side of Ring Around the Toesies and top out at the start of Ring Around the Toesies.
use small pockets on the wall
content.location: start on the pockets on the arête by the quarry and top out.

Climbers' side of big boulder. Up the obvious butt-looking crack (~BD#2). Spread 'em and get your feet on the rocks then put in one handjam to start. Handjams only until mantle. Bonus points if you don't crimp-jam on the starting hold. Topout on the horn.

content.description: Jams only. Somewhere around a BD#1 or BD#2. Probably good for learning how to handjam, as there are decent feet and it is less than vertical.
content.location: Slab side of big boulder. Go up the big crack. Jams only until top out, though you can continue to use the crack to mantle - probably a V0 if you do.

content.description: This route requires creativity. Purple indicates right hand, red indicates left hand, and black are suggested feet. **No hand matches** except for on the top out. Sit start in the crack on indicated hand and foot holds. Move up and left while keeping your feet to the right of the arch. Feet can never touch the left side. Avoid placing feet anywhere above yellow dotted line until throwing the high heel to finish. Crux will require finding proper feet to reach the top left pocket and a big mantle finish. Top out is to the right of the final top hold.
content.protection: Possible pad for the last two moves.
content.location: West face of the largest boulder.

content.description: Start with hands on red circled holds. Use a combination of the purple hand holds to work up to the black hold and top out. All features not circled are off limits for hand holds. All feet are good.
West face of "Big boulder." Sit start, climb pockets only, all other holds are barred!

content.location: Climber's side of big boulder. See picture for start. Left hand in a pocket, right hand on neighboring ledge. Big deadpoint to triangular ledge, then top out. No other holds used. If you are tall and/or have big wingspan, deadpoint to big pocket instead of ledge.

content.description:
On the same boulder as Rock-a-bye Baby

 Stand start using only top ring and bottom ring of the Boulder. Start jugs on right and traverse the whole and end at start holds. 

 Good warm up boulder.
Dyno to the top from the start holds
use only the left arete/crack and right crack (blue line crack) to compress and hug your way up this boulder! feet - whatever you can use!
Follow the obvious line to the top

Start on west side of the large arch. Use the two jugs around shoulder height, pull your feet up and set the bat hang on the top horn. Make the bat hang true by letting go of both starting holds. Bump holds to feet or campus to where the feet were for the bat hang. Set big mantle to the horn right of the top out hold. Feet should only touch the two black circles. All other footholds off limits.

This is a "Figure 8" traverse. Start off matching both hands on the north west point of the rock at the blue mark with feet on the green marks. Traverse right using the crack at the red line mark and various holds below it. Do not use a hold above the red line. Work your way under the middle cave and out to the south east face of the rock, avoiding any hold above the red line. Work around the south face and traverse left along the south west face to the cave again, following the same guidelines. Route is complete when hands and feet make it to the north starting point.
content.protection: Traverse stays low. No additional protection needed.
